content: crafters you have asked for it and I bring it to you

t-square and I've made a bunch of corners on this two ply cardboard now

a strip it's an inch wide and I'm cutting it in half or scoring it in half
so it'll be a half an inch on each side I'm using this corners in my project so

ply cardboard pieces corners that I cut okay so these are ready to go and I'll

so you can see those you can see that distressing I did on the on the ruin
itself when I twisted in the light all right
so I'm going to do the same thing to this room so I'm just putting these
pieces on now this one I'm actually going to break up so you can see I got
the bottom part in the top part looks like it crumbled like the detail itself

looking good ready for the next step now remember like I always say when you're

not gonna be able to get them all at once okay because you have to turn it

now I'm going to do the interior of that crack there in the building so just pour

nice texture that is hiding the corrugation but also giving the thing

so let this dry so I can just dump it off onto my tray now to sort this you

it's a nice nice stuff so now one nice thing I want to do is
